result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:55 AM Defendant JASON T RICE in court.  Attorney Alysa Otten in court.  Jennifer Gross appears for the State.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   State indicates no report has been received.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. RICE, JASON T     CASE:  22100620

Possession of Methamphetamine
Possession of Paraphernalia
OAR

11:24 AM DE Jason Rice in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak  (special appearance)appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  DEF makes statement. 
 Discussion follows.   Court sets bond.    Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 10/11/2022 at 8:30AM.  

CBS $1000   ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
